name: Charlotte Harbor
prompt:
Now, Click a location on the map.
After you select a point along the shoreline, you will enter the other parameters for the model. You can minimize this window and then select your location and reactivate the tool.

help.text: Choose the display and output units.
Check or uncheck the boxes to toggle the visibility of the ancillary GIS layers associated with this geography.

For your site, we can compute 4 types of waves that can be generated by a certain category of wind blowing in the Bay:
Maximum wave is the average wave height computed using maximum wind speed values
Strong wave is the average wave height computed from winds speed above the 90th percentile speed value,
Average wave is the average wave height computed from average wind speed values,
Most common wave is the average wave height computed from most common (modal) wind speed values.
Strong Storm is ....
Your reef can either be trapezoidal or a ReefBall™
Height of your reef, from base to crest
Cross-shore footprint (along the direction of wave propagation) of the reef.
Cross-shore width (along the direction of wave propagation) of the reef.

Coastal Defense
Use the input panels to the right to set parameters for model scenarios. Hover over the parameters with the mouse for more detailed information.

Select the 'Run Scenario' button to run the model and see how wave attenuation changes under your scenario compared to current conditions.
